The Executioner, The Groundstar Conspiracy, Rough Night in Jericho, Pork Chop Hill, The Carpetbaggers, Home from the Hill, and Breakfast at Tiffany's were all written by different screenwriters. Specifically, The Executioner was written by Jack Seddon, The Groundstar Conspiracy by Douglas Heyes, Rough Night in Jericho by Marvin H. Albert, Pork Chop Hill by William Humphrey, The Carpetbaggers by Harold Robbins, Home from the Hill by William Humphrey, and Breakfast at Tiffany's by Truman Capote.
